trans-unit.source: This page describes the Open Publishing workflow in use by the WDG Partner & ITPro CPub team.
trans-unit.target: This page describes the Open Publishing workflow in use by the WDG Partner & ITPro CPub team.

trans-unit.source: It is based on [GitHub Flow](http://scottchacon.com/2011/08/31/github-flow.html), as described by Scott Chacon.
trans-unit.target: It is based on [GitHub Flow](http://scottchacon.com/2011/08/31/github-flow.html), as described by Scott Chacon.

trans-unit.source: The golden rule of the workflow is that anything in the master branch is deployable.
trans-unit.target: The golden rule of the workflow is that anything in the master branch is deployable.

trans-unit.source: To make the changes on the GitHub site:
trans-unit.target: To make the changes on the GitHub site:

trans-unit.source: Open the file you want to change and click the pencil icon to enter edit mode.
trans-unit.target: Open the file you want to change and click the pencil icon to enter edit mode.

trans-unit.source: When you're done, scroll to the bottom of the page and choose Create a new branch.
trans-unit.target: When you're done, scroll to the bottom of the page and choose Create a new branch.

trans-unit.source: Change the name of the new branch, if you like.
trans-unit.target: Change the name of the new branch, if you like.

trans-unit.source: At this point, you can continue adding more changes to your new branch, or you can immediately submit a pull request.
trans-unit.target: At this point, you can continue adding more changes to your new branch, or you can immediately submit a pull request.

trans-unit.source: To make the changes in a local clone, use the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To make the changes in a local clone, use the following steps:

trans-unit.source: To work on something new, create a descriptively named branch off of master (ie: enterprise-wdk):
trans-unit.target: To work on something new, create a descriptively named branch off of master (ie: enterprise-wdk):

trans-unit.source: Commit to that branch locally and regularly push your work to the same named branch on the server.
trans-unit.target: Commit to that branch locally and regularly push your work to the same named branch on the server.

trans-unit.source: Iterate with others (tech review, edit) in your branch.
trans-unit.target: Iterate with others (tech review, edit) in your branch.

trans-unit.source: When the branch is ready to publish, open a pull request.
trans-unit.target: When the branch is ready to publish, open a pull request.

trans-unit.source: A peer or admin repo reviews the changes and merges the content into master.
trans-unit.target: A peer or admin repo reviews the changes and merges the content into master.

trans-unit.source: Once it is in master, a repo admin may deploy to the live branch at any time.
trans-unit.target: Once it is in master, a repo admin may deploy to the live branch at any time.
